name: znbas2
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)))
-| wceq(c1, co(zring, cqus, co(zring, cqg, cfv(c3, csn(c0)))))

stmt.origin: znbaslem(c0, cbs, c1, c2, c3, nat1)
stmt.pretty: znbaslem(c0, cbs, c1, c2, c3, nat1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(crsp, zring))
-| wceq(c1, co(zring, cqus, co(zring, cqg, cfv(c3, csn(c0)))))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(czn, c0))
-| wceq(cbs, cslot(nat1))
-| wcel(nat1, cn)
-| wbr(nat1, clt, cdc(nat1, nat0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ℕ0 →(Base ` c1)=(Base ` c2))
⊣ c3 =(RSpan ` ZZring)
⊣ c1 =(ZZring[/s](ZZring[~QG](c3 ` { c0 })))
⊣ c2 =(Z/nZ ` c0)
⊣ Base = Slot(1)
⊣ 1 ∈ ℕ
⊣ 1[<]cdc(1, 0)

comment: The base set of ` Z/nZ ` is the same as the quotient ring it is based on. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.) (Revised by AV, 13-Jun-2019.)
